The '''Almquist shell''' (also known as '''A Shell''', '''ash''' and '''sh''') was originally [[Kenneth Almquist]]'s clone of the [[SVR4]]-variant of the [[Bourne shell]]; it is a fast, small, [[POSIX]]-compatible [[Unix shell]] designed to replace the Bourne shell in later [[BSD]] distributions. By intention it did not feature line editing or [[command history]] mechanisms originally, because Almquist felt that such should be moved into the [[Computer terminal|terminal]] [[Device driver|driver]]. Current variants have [[emacs]] and [[vi]] modes.
The '''Almquist shell''' (also known as '''A Shell''', '''ash''' and '''sh''') was originally [[Kenneth Almquist]]'s clone of the [[SVR4]]-variant of the [[Bourne shell]]; it is a fast, small, [[POSIX]]-compatible [[Unix shell]] designed to replace the Bourne shell in later [[BSD]] distributions. By intention it did not feature line editing or [[command history]] mechanisms originally, because Almquist felt that such should be moved into the [[Computer terminal|terminal]] [[Device driver|driver]]. Current variants have [[emacs]] and [[vi]] modes.
